Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw their chosen habitat, showing whether it is on land (e.g., playground, garden, forest, parking lot) or in water (e.g., pond, stream, lake).
The student can include and label different types of plants found in the habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can include and label different types of animals found in the habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can show and label how the diversity of plants and animals differs between two habitats (optional comparison).
The student can identify patterns in the types of living things found and represent these patterns in their drawings with similar grouping or arrangement of species.
